verses.roman:
sa yācito bhagavatā
paripūrṇena sarvataḥ
sākṣepaṁ ruṣitaḥ prāha
bhṛtyo rājñaḥ su-durmadaḥ

synonyms: saḥ—he; yācitaḥ—requested; bhagavatā—by the Supreme Lord; paripūrṇena—who is absolutely complete; sarvataḥ—in all respects; sa-ākṣepam—insultingly; ruṣitaḥ—angered; prāha—he spoke; bhṛtyaḥ—the servant; rājñaḥ—of the King; su—very much; durmadaḥ—falsely proud.
translation: Thus requested by the Supreme Lord, who is perfectly complete in all respects, that arrogant servant of the King became angry and replied insultingly.
